alert.note: Alert for Albany; Greene; Schoharie; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 07 at 11:38AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following counties, Albany, Greene, Schoharie and Ulster. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1138 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cobleskill, Ellenville, Hunter, Jefferson, Woodstock, Westerlo, Berne, Altamont, Windham, Middleburgh, Gilboa, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Prattsville, Lanesville, Phoenicia, Woodland Valley Campground, Preston-Potter Hollow and Mount Tremper. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
